required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Transperineal US in Stress Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Role of Transperineal US in Differentiating Degrees of Genuine Stress Incontinence in Females Diagnosed by Urodynamics

brief_summary.textblock:
Stress urinary incontinence (SUI) has an observed prevalence of between 4%and 35%.Identified risk factors are aging, obesity and repeated pregnancies and deliveries.
Urodynamic remains the gold standard for diagnosis in the past years. Trans labial ultrasound appears to have a good role in diagnosing stress incontinence

detailed_description.textblock:
A comparative observational cross sectional study will be conducted .
The symptom, or "subjective indicator of disease," of SUI is described as "the complaint of involuntary leakage on effort or exertion, or on sneezing or coughing." 1 Stress urinary incontinence (SUI) has an observed prevalence of between 4% and 35%.
It's a social problem that causes hygienic problem that s distressing for females.
Urodynamic study is the gold standard for diagnosis of most types of urinary incontinence with some limitations as it's not done routinely in all cases of urinary incontinence according to the NICE guidelines 2 Translabial ultrasound is a simple, noninvasive, available, and reproducible method for qualitative and quantitative evaluation of the lower urinary tract in females.

primary_outcome.measure: The number of participants who will be properly diagnosed to have genuine stress incontinence To determine the role of transperineal ultrasound in diagnosing stress incontinence
primary_outcome.description: the outcome describes how much the transperineal us have a power to diagnose stress incontinence in comparison to urodynamic study

intervention.description: Every women with stress incontinence witll be subjected to urodynamics to confirm genuine stress incontinence then will be subjected Transperineal US

study_pop.textblock: females who are complaining from stress incontinence that did urodynamics study and proved to have a genuine stress incontinence and referred to do transperineal ultrasound

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
females between 20-75 years old
- -Women diagnosed to have genuine stress urinary incontinence diagnosed by history taking, voiding diary and confirmed by urodynamic.
Exclusion Criteria:
- -Known to be Diabetic
- Urge incontinence or mixed type
- Voiding dysfunction
- Neurological problems
- open suprapubic wound
- Previous surgery for POP(pelvic organ prolapse) or incontinence
- suspicion of pelvic malignancy

eligibility.gender_description: females who are complaining from stress incontinence

overall_official.affiliation: Algazeerah hospital -Location (Giza -Egypt ) and National Research centre egypt

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Researcher , National Research centre and Specialist of Obstetrics and Gynecology in Aljazeerah hospital
